melanoma_segmentation.models package#

Submodules#

melanoma_segmentation.models.attention_unet module#

class melanoma_segmentation.models.attention_unet.AttUNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1)#

Bases: Module

Attention U-Net architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model uses an encoder-decoder architecture with attention gates in the skip connections to focus on relevant features, improving segmentation results.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder convolutional blocks for extracting features at different scales.

Type:

ConvBlock

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

bottleneck#

Bottleneck convolutional block connecting the encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

ConvBlock

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

UpConv

attention1, attention2, attention3, attention4

Attention blocks applied to the skip connections between encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

AttentionBlock

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder convolutional blocks for feature refinement.

Type:

ConvBlock

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the Attention U-Net model.

forward(x)#

Forward pass for the Attention U-Net model.

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – Input tensor of shape (N, C, H, W) where: - N is the batch size - C is the number of input channels - H is the height of the input image - W is the width of the input image

Returns:

Output tensor of shape (N, out_channels, H, W).

Return type:

torch.Tensor

class melanoma_segmentation.models.attention_unet.AttentionBlock(F_g, F_l, F_int)#

Bases: Module

Attention Block for the Attention U-Net model.

This block performs attention-based gating, which emphasizes the most relevant features from the skip connections, improving segmentation accuracy.

Parameters:

  • F_g (int) – Number of channels in the gating signal (decoder feature map).

  • F_l (int) – Number of channels in the skip connection signal.

  • F_int (int) – Number of intermediate channels used in the attention mechanism.

W_g#

Convolution and Batch Normalization applied to the gating signal.

Type:

nn.Sequential

W_x#

Convolution and Batch Normalization applied to the skip connection.

Type:

nn.Sequential

psi#

Final 1x1 convolution, followed by a sigmoid activation for producing the attention weights.

Type:

nn.Sequential

relu#

ReLU activation applied to the combined feature map.

Type:

nn.ReLU

forward(g, x)#

Performs the forward pass of the attention block.

melanoma_segmentation.models.residual_recurrent_unet module#

class melanoma_segmentation.models.residual_recurrent_unet.R2UNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1, t=2)#

Bases: Module

R2U-Net architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model is an extension of U-Net using residual recurrent blocks to improve feature learning by adding recurrent convolutions and residual connections.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

  • t (int, optional) – Number of recurrent steps in each block. Default is 2.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder blocks consisting of residual recurrent blocks.

Type:

nn.Sequential

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

bottleneck#

Bottleneck block connecting the encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

nn.Sequential

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

UpConv

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder blocks consisting of residual recurrent blocks.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the R2U-Net model.

class melanoma_segmentation.models.residual_recurrent_unet.RecurrentBlock(ch_out, t=2)#

Bases: Module

Recurrent block used in the R2U-Net model to apply multiple convolutions on the input feature map.

Parameters:

  • ch_out (int) – Number of output channels.

  • t (int, optional) – Number of recurrent steps (default is 2).

conv#

A sequence of convolution, batch normalization, and ReLU activation layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the recurrent block.

class melanoma_segmentation.models.residual_recurrent_unet.ResidualRecurrentBlock(ch_in, ch_out, t=2)#

Bases: Module

Residual block with recurrent convolutions for the R2U-Net model.

Parameters:

  • ch_in (int) – Number of input channels.

  • ch_out (int) – Number of output channels.

  • t (int, optional) – Number of recurrent steps (default is 2).

conv1x1#

A 1x1 convolutional layer to match the dimensions between input and output channels.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

rcnn#

A recurrent block for repeated convolution operations.

Type:

RecurrentBlock

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the residual recurrent block.

melanoma_segmentation.models.trans_unet module#

class melanoma_segmentation.models.trans_unet.DepthwiseConvBlock(ch_in, ch_out)#

Bases: Module

Depthwise convolutional block used in the TransUNet model for efficient feature extraction.

This block employs depthwise and pointwise convolutions followed by batch normalization and ReLU activation.

Parameters:

  • ch_in (int) – Number of input channels.

  • ch_out (int) – Number of output channels.

conv1#

Depthwise convolution with ch_in groups.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

pointwise1#

Pointwise convolution for combining depthwise convolutions.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

bn1#

Batch normalization applied after the first convolution.

Type:

nn.BatchNorm2d

conv2#

Depthwise convolution with ch_out groups.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

pointwise2#

Pointwise convolution for combining depthwise convolutions.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

bn2#

Batch normalization applied after the second convolution.

Type:

nn.BatchNorm2d

relu#

ReLU activation function.

Type:

nn.ReLU

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the depthwise convolutional block.

Methods

class melanoma_segmentation.models.trans_unet.TransUNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1, transformer_dim=256, num_heads=4, mlp_dim=512, transformer_depth=6)#

Bases: Module

TransUNet architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model combines convolutional encoders with transformer blocks in the bottleneck to capture both local and global dependencies for image segmentation.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

  • transformer_dim (int, optional) – Dimension of the transformer features. Default is 256.

  • num_heads (int, optional) – Number of attention heads in each transformer block. Default is 4.

  • mlp_dim (int, optional) – Dimension of the feed-forward MLP in the transformer block. Default is 512.

  • transformer_depth (int, optional) – Number of transformer blocks in the bottleneck. Default is 6.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder blocks using depthwise convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

transformer_blocks#

Sequence of transformer blocks in the bottleneck.

Type:

nn.Sequential

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

nn.ConvTranspose2d

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder blocks using depthwise convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the TransUNet model.

class melanoma_segmentation.models.trans_unet.TransformerBlock(dim, heads, mlp_dim, dropout=0.1)#

Bases: Module

Transformer block used in the TransUNet model.

This block employs multi-head self-attention followed by a feed-forward MLP with GELU activation.

Parameters:

  • dim (int) – Dimension of the input and output features.

  • heads (int) – Number of attention heads.

  • mlp_dim (int) – Dimension of the feed-forward MLP.

  • dropout (float, optional) – Dropout rate applied to the attention and MLP layers. Default is 0.1.

attn#

Multi-head self-attention layer.

Type:

nn.MultiheadAttention

norm1#

Layer normalization applied after attention.

Type:

nn.LayerNorm

mlp#

Feed-forward MLP with GELU activation and dropout.

Type:

nn.Sequential

norm2#

Layer normalization applied after the feed-forward MLP.

Type:

nn.LayerNorm

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the transformer block.

melanoma_segmentation.models.transform module#

melanoma_segmentation.models.transform.get_transforms(phase, image_size)#

Get the appropriate transforms for the specified phase.

This function returns a set of transformations for image preprocessing based on the specified phase. During training, data augmentation techniques such as horizontal flipping are applied, whereas in the testing/validation phase, only resizing and normalization are performed.

Parameters:

  • phase (str) – The phase of the transformation. Must be one of ‘train’ or ‘test’.

  • image_size (int) – The size to which the images will be resized (height and width will be equal).

Returns:

A composition of transformations from the Albumentations library.

Return type:

A.Compose

Raises:

ValueError – If an unsupported phase is specified.

Examples

>>> train_transforms = get_transforms(phase="train", image_size=256)
>>> val_transforms = get_transforms(phase="test", image_size=256)

melanoma_segmentation.models.unet module#

class melanoma_segmentation.models.unet.UNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1)#

Bases: Module

U-Net architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model uses an encoder-decoder architecture with skip connections between corresponding layers in the encoder and decoder paths to preserve spatial information at different resolutions.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder blocks consisting of convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

bottleneck#

Bottleneck block connecting the encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

nn.Sequential

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

UpConv

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder blocks consisting of convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the U-Net model.

Module contents#

class melanoma_segmentation.models.AttUNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1)#

Bases: Module

Attention U-Net architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model uses an encoder-decoder architecture with attention gates in the skip connections to focus on relevant features, improving segmentation results.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder convolutional blocks for extracting features at different scales.

Type:

ConvBlock

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

bottleneck#

Bottleneck convolutional block connecting the encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

ConvBlock

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

UpConv

attention1, attention2, attention3, attention4

Attention blocks applied to the skip connections between encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

AttentionBlock

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder convolutional blocks for feature refinement.

Type:

ConvBlock

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the Attention U-Net model.

class melanoma_segmentation.models.R2UNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1, t=2)#

Bases: Module

R2U-Net architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model is an extension of U-Net using residual recurrent blocks to improve feature learning by adding recurrent convolutions and residual connections.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

  • t (int, optional) – Number of recurrent steps in each block. Default is 2.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder blocks consisting of residual recurrent blocks.

Type:

nn.Sequential

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

bottleneck#

Bottleneck block connecting the encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

nn.Sequential

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

UpConv

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder blocks consisting of residual recurrent blocks.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the R2U-Net model.

class melanoma_segmentation.models.TransUNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1, transformer_dim=256, num_heads=4, mlp_dim=512, transformer_depth=6)#

Bases: Module

TransUNet architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model combines convolutional encoders with transformer blocks in the bottleneck to capture both local and global dependencies for image segmentation.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

  • transformer_dim (int, optional) – Dimension of the transformer features. Default is 256.

  • num_heads (int, optional) – Number of attention heads in each transformer block. Default is 4.

  • mlp_dim (int, optional) – Dimension of the feed-forward MLP in the transformer block. Default is 512.

  • transformer_depth (int, optional) – Number of transformer blocks in the bottleneck. Default is 6.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder blocks using depthwise convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

transformer_blocks#

Sequence of transformer blocks in the bottleneck.

Type:

nn.Sequential

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

nn.ConvTranspose2d

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder blocks using depthwise convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the TransUNet model.

class melanoma_segmentation.models.UNet(in_channels=3, out_channels=1)#

Bases: Module

U-Net architecture for image segmentation tasks.

This model uses an encoder-decoder architecture with skip connections between corresponding layers in the encoder and decoder paths to preserve spatial information at different resolutions.

Parameters:

  • in_channels (int, optional) – Number of input channels. Default is 3.

  • out_channels (int, optional) – Number of output channels. Default is 1.

encoder1, encoder2, encoder3, encoder4

Encoder blocks consisting of convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

pool1, pool2, pool3, pool4

Pooling layers for downsampling the feature maps.

Type:

nn.MaxPool2d

bottleneck#

Bottleneck block connecting the encoder and decoder paths.

Type:

nn.Sequential

upconv1, upconv2, upconv3, upconv4

Upsampling layers for increasing the feature map size in the decoder path.

Type:

UpConv

decoder1, decoder2, decoder3, decoder4

Decoder blocks consisting of convolutional layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

Conv_1x1#

Final 1x1 convolutional layer for producing the output segmentation map.

Type:

nn.Conv2d

forward(x)#

Performs the forward pass of the U-Net model.
